snippet: John M. Howting visited community organizing offices last week, claiming he wanted to start a union, but he was actually part of a scheme to goad liberal groups into saying something incriminating.
abstract: Michael Powell Gotham column notes young conservatives have made a cottage industry of going undercover and trying to goad people working at perceived liberal institutions into making incriminating statements; says lately they have set their sights on the Industrial Areas Foundation, organizing group founded by the late Saul Alinsky; notes in the 1980s, an Alinsky-style organizer trained the young Barack Obama.
lead_paragraph: John M. Howting visited community organizing offices last week, claiming he wanted to start a union, but he was actually part of a scheme to goad liberal groups into saying something incriminating.

headline.seo: From a Fake Union Organizer, an Anti-Liberal Scheme
headline.main: At Advocates’ Offices, Confronting an Anti-Liberal Scheme
headline.print_headline: At Advocates’ Offices, Confronting an Anti-Liberal Scheme
